39397765.review:
I was skeptical about whether I would enjoy this game or not apon first glance, seeing as how the game has a "strange" playing perspective I had never experienced before, but I was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed my time. With that said here are the pros and cons (for me):

[h1] Pros [/h1]
-Different enemies and variations of enemies in every area,
-Good controls using a USB controller,
-Fun combat,
-The game looks alright,
-Operates smoothly (no screen tearing or frame drops),
-I never experienced any glitches during my time on the game,
-Good Soundtrack,
-Fun boss fights.

[h1] Cons [/h1]
-You cannot change the difficulty of your save file,
-Keyboard controls are awkward.

39380176.review:
受朋友推荐，伊苏起源是我购买的第一款伊苏系列的游戏。虽然它好评如潮，但是我不得不说，或许它在刚推出之时确实非常优秀，但时间已经发展到2018年，不考虑其他乱七八糟的因素，只以现在的眼光来看，这款游戏的瑕疵还是非常多的。它可以算作良作，但是离神作真的还非常的远。
      首先说下，本人只玩过噩梦难度，噩梦time attack除了Toal的Kishgal之外都能在10次之内过，肯定不算高手但是也算有点技术，所以我的评价是从一个相对硬核的玩家角度来说的。

       我对这款游戏我最大的不满就来源于战斗方面。第一，它有着传统日式游戏的通病：需要肝。游戏内等级压制非常严重，和敌人差距一两级都会导致战斗力差距非常悬殊。这导致了正常的过流程走到BOSS前（几乎）是绝对打不过BOSS的，枯燥的刷怪练级必不可少，这对我这种不喜欢重复劳动的是一个非常大的问题。而如果你愿意肝，能肝到time attack等级两三级甚至以上，那么即使是噩梦难度也是随便就能过，这种靠肝来赢的办法我觉得是非常无趣的。
       第二，BOSS设计不够好。伊苏起源BOSS众多，BOSS战是极大的组成部分，对我来说，很多BOSS战给我的感觉并非爽快，而是烦人。伊苏的BOSS战大多是完全的背板，BOSS攻击方式比较固定，然后玩家躲避的方式也非常单一。大多BOSS空档非常固定，像Epona，铁之古王（还是挺像的）之类的甚至就一个稳定空档，导致几乎所有BOSS流程都是躲半天技能--BOSS露出空档--砍两下--BOSS恢复正常--重复，这种无变数的重复劳动反正给我带来的不是爽而是枯燥。尤其是袭击YS的几大恶魔，不是能回血就是满地炸弹，还有个螳螂甚至能复活，手稍微慢一点打的血就没回得快，打完手指酸的一笔，搞的我都想开按键精灵，这种强行通过拉长流程增加游戏难度的设定着实让我非常蛋疼。
       第三点，游戏难度偏大。对我来说，鬼泣4的DMD都比伊苏起源容易。这款游戏受发售时代限制，FALCOM也是小厂，主角无法整出来什么华丽惊人的操作我也理解。但是，Hugo和Toal还好说，Yunica既没有稳定的格挡（雷时间太短，还有额外蓝耗，不能算），又没有高机动性，这个被官方摆在第一个让人以为最容易上手的人物非常难以面对各种各样的高伤害追踪技能。即使是高机动性的Toal，我面对Shion的二阶段也死了二十多次（大量高速跟踪弹幕，碰一次掉1/4血）。海量的小怪不光能够靠数量压制，伤害也很高，比如如果操作大意，海底关的乌龟这种小怪甚至都可以直接满血秒杀主角（满血只能吃四下电击，电击小硬直导致逃不开电击范围），加上各种方向诡异判定很迷的追踪AOE，除了披风无稳定回血能力，SP获得量极低祝福形同虚设等等多种设定，让这个游戏的难度显得实在是过高而且高的人有点没有玩的欲望。

       剧情方面就不多说了，这种剧情现在看来已经烂大街了，但是在当年可能确实是相当震撼人心的。不过我个人认为人物多对话少导致人物塑造不足是一个很大的问题，除了三主角，其他角色出场篇幅都非常的少，根本就没时间去好好体现人物的魅力。而且三主角的方法虽然有助于主角形象的塑造，但是三周目的重复流程确实也降低了玩家的游戏体验。

       总而言之，我认为以2018年的眼光去看这款游戏，这款游戏虽然确实有很多有点，但是瑕疵真的非常多。如果你不像我一样会很在意高难度下的战斗逻辑等问题，就是正常难度玩个爽，顺便看看剧情，那么这款游戏其实很不错，价钱也很合算。但是如果你是没玩过这款游戏的硬核玩家，不考虑情怀，只考虑游戏质量，那么说实在的，不推荐购买，因为这款游戏的高难度真的是只能让人感受到难，而不是爽。

39339254.review:
Ys Origin is an excellent and difficult ARPG tailored for hardcore gamers, but it also includes difficulty settings that will allow more casual gamers to enjoy it without being overwhelmed.  The story holds a great deal of nostalgia value for fans of the first two Ys games, but no prior knowledge is needed to understand and enjoy it.

The game world consists of only a single massive dungeon, though it does offer you a safe area at the start that you can warp back to at any time to consult with friendly NPCs and upgrade your weapon.  The dungeon itself is mostly a single path, with many short branches down which you will find critical upgrades.  Exploration is not emphasized in this game.  Combat is!

The difficulty even on the normal setting for this game is fairly challenging.  It expects you to find and make use of every upgrade, meaning that if you miss one, you may suddenly find yourself struggling (don't worry, you can go back to get anything you miss at any time).  Needless to say, Nitemare difficulty leaves very little room for mistakes!  Bosses all come with multiple phases and many unique attack patterns.  Healing during a boss fight is impossible, which makes it critical to avoid taking hits.  Even if a single hit doesn't seem very damaging, they will add up over the course of the fight if you are careless!

There are three main characters to choose from (one is unlockable) each with their own unique moveset and story.  This adds significant replay value to the game, for not only are you treated to an entirely unique perspective storywise, but you might find that facing down certain bosses with a radically different moveset requires an entirely different strategy.  On top of this there are also bonus modes, like Boss Rush and Time Attack.

I would recommend this game to any and all fans of the ARPG genre.  It is certainly an excellent game!

38874870.review:
Das Spiel spielt sich wie ein großer Boss Gaunlet, der von Arealen zum Aufrüsten und Story Elementen unterbrochen wird. Die Bosse sind alle unterschiedlich genug um es zu genießen. Fertigkeiten, die man erlangt um den Weg weiter zu gehen fühlen sich teilweise nur wie Schlüssel an, da sie im späteren Spiel nicht mehr gebraucht werden.
Die meisten großen Bosse machen es notwenig auf sie zu springen um ihre Schwachpunkte zu attackieren. Aber die Sprite zu Sprite Interaktion kann hier ein bisschen schlüpfrig sein. Das wohl da die Bossmonster nicht wirklich Plattformen sind und der spielbare Charakter an Ecken hängen bleiben kann oder and Schrägen abrutscht.

Die Daialoge waren mir oft zu lang und das Spiel bricht für mich so ziemlich die Regel von "Zeige, erzahl nicht!". Die Hintergrundgeschichten der Charakter mögen zwar nett sein und ergänzen sich ganz gut mit den 3 spielbaren Charakteren im Spiel. Aber, da man als Spieler nichts davon erlebt hat ist es schwer sich involviert zu fühlen.
Statt diesen langen Prologue mit Yggdrasil dem Weltenbaum hätte die Geschichte vielleicht auf dieser Himmelsinsel starten können. Da dieser Ort im finalen Bosskampf und damit als Teil der Spielstory als so wichtig erachtet wird. Aber man hat Spieler keinen Bezug dazu.

Es wäre nett gewesen wirklich wenigstens einen der "Dunkelinge" spielen zu können anstatt Toad, der nur auf die Seite der "Dunkelinge" gewechselt war. (Toad ist ein Charakter, der freigespielt wird wenn man mit Hugo und Yunika durgespielt hat.) Das hätte für mich mehr tiefe in die Geschichte bebracht. Vielleicht war das an einem Punkt geplant gewesen, aber man hat es dann nicht umgesetzt. Die Hintergrund Geschichten dieser Charakter und warum sie genau diese Macht erstrebt haben wäre sehr interessant gewesen.

Die posiitven Seiten sind die Atmosphäre. Tatsächlich sind die Graphiken und Musik das was ich mir von einem 3D "Metroidvania" gewünscht hätte.

Die Story nur in Rückblenden erzählt zu bekommen und, dass erworbende Fertigkeiten wie das Unterwasser Atmen und diese Maske, die Geheimnisse sichtbar macht, nur einmal wirklich nützlich waren ist schade.

Aber es hat trotzdem eine Menge Spaß gemacht zu spielen. Auch wenn ich mich nicht berufen fühle auf Achievment Jagd zu gehen oder das Spiel auf einem höheren Schwierigkeitsgrad als "Normal" durch zu spielen.

38718506.review:
Ys Origin, aquele jogo onde explicam muito sobre a história de Ys Chronicles (Ys I e Ys II).
A ideia é excelente, as lacunas preenchidas são satisfatórias, e carrega, como era de se esperar, tudo que a série Ys tem de melhor: trilha sonora, história, jogabilidade; exceto uma coisa: nosso adorável Adol Christin.

A história acontece séculos antes de Ys I, tratando de eventos relacionados ao fato de Ys ser uma ilha flutuante, as deusas estarem da maneira que estão em Ys Chronicles e, não jogamos com Adol, mas controlamos dois ancestrais dos sacerdotes deste jogo.

O grande problema da campanha curta de Chronicles é corrigido aqui, com um jogo que pode exigir de 10 a 15 horas (ou mais, dependendo do jogador) num first run. Sendo dois personagens e um secreto, com pouca diferença em termos de tempo, o jogo vai exigir, no mínimo, 25 a 30 horas para que todas as informações possíveis do jogo sejam reveladas.

Vale o tempo gasto, tio Zanatus? Com certeza. A trilha sonora, como dito, mantém a qualidade, trazendo ainda músicas antigas e conhecidas, em remasterizações e melhoras nos arranjos. 
A jogabilidade foi melhorada, abandonando o bump system passando para um action/RPG de ação mais frenética e intuitiva, ainda contando com sistema de combos, rápidas trocas de magias e armas, e uma míriade de comandos para ataques diferentes.

Compra obrigatória para qualquer um que jogou o Chronicles.

Os CONTRAS? O jogo ainda exige grind, e isso é um ponto bom e ruim, por não se tratar de um grind comum a RPGs e similares. Nas dificuldades extras e modos extras, o replay é muito alto, mas a dificuldade vai afastar boa parte dos jogadores.
Todos podem zerar? Sim. Mas nem todos vão conseguir terminar os modos extras ou o jogo normal, nas dificuldades mais elevadas. Típico de Ys, mas em Origin, a coisa parece um pouco pior.

38654133.review:
Bought this during the current sale (December 2017). 

This is one of the best games I've played in the last few years. Simple Story. Fast and Exciting gameplay. Relatable Characters. And there are still more to come for me. I was scrolling looking for a game like Tales Of and came across this series. I went to http://digitalemelas.com/index_ys.php to figure where I should start the saga. You should check out the link, if you want a little background on what the series entails. 

More about the game.

There are two characters you can start out with, Yunica and Hugo. So far I would say Yunica and one of the hidden characters has the best story line. I'm easily going to sink another 5-7hrs each hidden character you can unlock. Besides that it is pretty simple. You are to fight your way through waves of demons to find out why the two Goddesses have went missing. You learn more about the land and a bit about the people outside of your home, the solomon shrine, and what has really caused all of the conflict in the land.

The controls are very responsive on controller and mouse/keyboard. I've played through it with both and feel like it is easier to just plug in a controller and get to work. I prefer m/key though.

I really don't know what to say more. I don't usually ever write reviews. I would recommend picking this game up though. 

Good time no Alcohol required.

38528582.review: Ys Origins is a definite must play for those who really want to explore the history behind the Ys kingdom or want a fresh experience from Adol`s adventures. I loved the action gameplay and the different variety of dungeons that you can explore. The magic system was also cool but too reliant upon. This game`s style reminds me a lot of Oath in Felghana`s gameplay with the magic and combat. It was nice to see the similarities. It was cool to play as three different characters, each with their own backstories and combat traits unique to them. I thought the whole endless dungeon crawler became repetitive over time as I completed each character`s story one after another. I thought we`d actually be able to explore the kingdom of Ys in this game but it was just a tower structure with endless dungeons one after the other. Regardless, the game does a great job of introducing the characters and the story behind the goddesses as well. I thought it was really well done and one of my favorite Ys games.

38155436.review:
在浩瀚的历史长河中，曾有过一个神话般的国度，她的名字叫做伊苏。在双子女神和六位神宫的统治下，伊苏民富国强，繁极一时。其根源，就在于能为人们带来各种莫大恩惠的女神之至宝——《黑珍珠》，和通过《魔法》实现无数奇迹、并将其魔力进行增幅的金属《克莱里亚》——
　　由于这两者的存在，伊苏国日进不衰。对于这种繁荣将会一直持续下去，人们深信不疑。
　　——然而，灾厄总是骤然而至。就在某一天里，无数的魔物突然毫无征兆地出现在伊苏，它们肆无忌惮地蹂躏着这片大地，最终将人们都逼退到了女神所处的居所《萨尔蒙神殿》之中。
　　就在大家都认为一切都结束了的时候，女神和六神宫们利用《黑珍珠》的力量，成功地将神殿浮上了蓝天。但是，随着地面上一座巨型《塔》的建成，身附翼翅的魔物们纷纷飞上高空袭向浮城，破灭的危机感再次浮上了人们的心头。
　　正所谓祸乱相踵。就在这个时候，远离大地的萨尔蒙神殿里发生了一件意想不到的事件——作为伊苏国的象征的双子女神居然消失了！在人们的绝望声中，六神宫做出了一个果断的决定：从骑士和魔法师当中精选出优秀人材，以搜寻失踪了的女神。
　　就这样，这些肩负历史重责的人们，又重新回到了被黑暗笼罩着的大地上……

37823208.review:
Jogo produzido originalmente em 2006 e que ganhou este porte para a steam 10 anos depois,que como o próprio nome diz conta o que aconteceu 700 anos antes de Ys Vanished Omen e Ys 2 Ancient Ys vanished.
Para os que já conhecem a franquia que já tem aproximadamente 28 anos e vários titulos,mesmo que aqui no ocidente ela não seja muito popular no Japão está no mesmo nivel de Castlevania,Legends of Zelda entre outras,este jogo irá contar um pouco mais sobre as 6 familias de sacerdotes  e as duas deusas,alem da origem da Torre de Darm.
Primeiro jogo da frânquia aonde Adon Christen não é o protagonista(mesmo assim pode liberar ele para jogar o boss rush)  e que conta com 3 personagens 2 já disponiveis quando você começa pela primeira vez Yunica Tohva e Hugo fact e um terceiro The Claw liberado após terminar o jogo ou com a Yunica ou com o Hugo tanto faz a ordem,más recomendo terminar  o jogo com os dois antes de jogar com o The Claw,os motivos não vou contar para não spoilar para quem nunca jogou.
A jogabilidade é agradavel combina elementos de beating ups combinados com rpg e cada personagem terá uma gameplay diferenciada e itens diferentes que deverá obter ao longo do jogo.
para quem já jogou outros jogos da série Ys Origin se assemelha muito a Oath in felgana e Arc of Nalpistin.
O que torna este Ys legal é que para jogalo não é necessário conhecer o resto da franquia já que ele na verdade seria o começo de tudo contado após 6 sequelas(ys 3 wanderers from Ys (por curiosidade o unico jogo aonde Adol tem falas diretas) foi relançado 3 vezes uma para playstation seguindo o estilo do jogo classico más totalmente redesenhado e Oath in Felgana para playstation e depois para PC colocando uma gameplay diferente e recontando a história de outra forma) então é bem provavel que você ache bastante jogos da série já que os clássicos foram remasterizados,más infelizmente o Ys 4 Mask of the Sun para Playstation só tem em japones.
Finalizando Ys origin é um jogo que vai lhe divertir,roda em praticamente qualquer pc e apesar de valer o preço vira e volta tem um bom desconto.
Então podem comprar sem arrependimentos.

37526059.review:
I played Ys: Oath in Felghana a few years ago and absolutely loved it. Seeing the similarities with this game I decided to pick it up, and while I wasn't disappointed I also wasn't nearly as impressed as I was with Oath in Felghana.

The game takes place all in a tower with numerous floors. The floors have different themes, but they're still floors in a tower. As a result the game doesn't really feel as grand in scope as Oath in Felghana. It feels like a long day, which I guess is the intent going by the story, but somehow it just lacks that same feel of a big journey that I tend to enjoy in games like this. Oath in Felghana took you from mines to volcanoes to mountains to castles, and the varieties of enemies and bosses complemented that. There is still variety in bosses and enemies in this game, but it just doesn't feel nearly as expansive.

There's also a sort of eye-rolling quality to the story that Oath in Felghana didn't have. Maybe this is because I played through as Yunica, but the "oh I'm so inexperienced" shtick got rather annoying pretty quickly. Maybe this is also due to the tower theme, as over the course of a long day she went from totally inexperienced to besting legendary demons of unimaginable power. There are two other characters, one of which is unlocked, and they may not have had that same annoyance factor, but I couldn't really get up the desire to play through the game again.

Which I guess leads to my personal biggest point in the comparison to Oath in Felghana, which is that I replayed Oath 3 times moving up through the various difficulties, whereas this game I picked the hard difficulty, played through once, and couldn't summon the interest to play it again. I enjoyed the one playthrough, but it just didn't stick with me and keep me wanting more like Oath in Felghana did.

Based on all that, if you had to pick one Ys title to play, don't make it this one - go for Oath in Felghana. But if you loved Oath and want more, this game might not wow you in the same ways but it will still satisfy.

36153008.review:
For the very first time I am playing all Ys games. Until very recently I have never played nor seen anyone play any of the Ys games. Around Sept/20 2017 I started with Ys I, then Ys II, followed by Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim, Ys: The Oath in Felghana, Ys Orgin then I just beat Ys Seven.  Finally Ys VIII Lacrimosa of Dana is all that is left. With a early 2018 expected release date for PC. Below is how I rank the games I have played and beat so far from best to worst. I will edit this review as I play and beat more Ys games. 

<Best>
Ys Seven
Ys: The Oath in Felghana
Ys: Origin
Ys II 
Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim 
Ys I
<Worst>

Still Left to Play...
Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana

What I thought of "YS: Origin"
The game is solid. The combat and attack controls are better then any other Ys game. Near perfection I must say.  Normal enemies are not as tough to take down as in other Ys titles. But feel detailed and original even among other Ys games.. The boss fights are very challenging! The game is not the longest in length but has three charachters meaning more replay value. Level design is fairly good too. The game has less metroidvania elements then other Ys games but it still gets the job done. What I mean by metroidvania is returning to old areas with new powers to exsplore more. There are parts were you will get a little tired of grinding but other Ys games have been worse. No major issues I have with the game. As in many Ys Games the controls and combat may take a little to get used too. This is my third favorite Ys game but the combat itself is definatly the best in my opinion.

First of all: Xbox 360 controller buttons (this is not explained anywhere in the game):

Move: Either analog stick or the D-Pad
Menu: Click the right stick 
Attack: A
Jump: B
Boost: Y
Special: X (hold to charge)
Sprint: Hold A or double dash with movement button
Quick swap skill: LB

2.5D Anime Dark Souls. That's the best sum up I guess. I've never played a hack and slash JRPG before but that was really fun. I like really fun. One of the better games that I've played recently.

The story is good albeit cheesy. There is nothing wrong with it but not as deep as other JRPGs, say Final Fantasy for example (7/8/9/10). 

The gameplay is the best part of the game. There is a fine balance of platforming (combined with basic puzzles) and action. And boss fights where the game really shines. Pure awesomeness. Well it's mostly pattern recognition but as I said never really played a game like that before. 

So I can highly recommend it and I think will play Ys 7 next.

34889686.review:
I couldn't tell you how much I love this series. Ever since I've played Ys VI, I've been hooked. Oath in Felghana drew me in with it's fast-paced and action packed RPG gameplay.

This game is no exception, and was well worth the years it took to finally get an English translation. I have to say, I'm not disappionted.

The main thing that sets this game apart from the others was the inclusion of 3 playable characters (before Seven made the party system). Each of these characters play different enough from each other, and each of them are just so much fun to play.

Playable Characters: Yunica is as close to the familiar gameplay that started with Ys VI, with strong melee and straightforward magic attacks. Hugo is a ranged spellcaster with interesting magic attacks. Then you unlock the Claw, who uses fast melee with a powerful boost mode to go with it (you'll understand when unlock him). 

The Gameplay: This game is a fast paced 3D platforming Action RPG style game. The combat is fast, brutal, and some enemies will require more than just hacking and slashing to beat. Learn your movement and attacks, and you should do just fine. There is some exploration, but nothing too big, so you shouldn't get lost. The controls are pretty simple and fluid, but I do recommand a controller.

The Presentation: The presentation pretty good, even if the enviroments aren't the most impressive looking. Then again, graphics can't sell a game completely. After all, a shiny pile of crap is still a pile of crap. The character artwork looks nice too, and the visual effects are nice to look at as you slaughter your way through monsters. 

The Music: As to be expected from Falcom's own in house rock band, the songs are blood pumping rock songs. Each song will get you pumped to fight all manner of monsters, be it a set of mooks or a massive boss. The Ys is legendardy for this, and this game has it just as good.

The Story: As far as plots go, they're pretty alright. Ys has never really been known for complex or deep storylines, but it's decent enough to keep you interested in the characters. I'm not gonna say much, because why would I spoil the plot? Thankfully, the plot is fast enough that you won't be spending too much time on the dialouge, so you can get right back to the action.

The Difficulty: There's plenty of options here for anyone to enjoy. You can take it easy on lower difficulites like Easy or Normal, or go straight for a quick death on something like Nightmare or Inferno mode.

Extra Modes: Even if you finish the Story mode, you still have Time Attack, a Boss Rush mode, and an Arena mode with some extra goodies to get from playing it. Arena Mode is where most of my hours after the Story Mode was done.

In Conclusion: This game is simply wonderful. It's well worth the price and will give you plenty of enjoyment for hours. The only problems you may find is that the platforming can be a little problematic at times, but nothing you can't deal with. Overall, I recommand this game and any of the other Ys games you can find on Steam.

34455302.review:
Probably one of my favorite of the pre-party system Ys games.  The most refined combat and best level design.  Which, well, is good...because you're going to be playing it through several times.  The good this game does, in giving you three unique characters to play with, having one of the more fleshed-out stories of the older Ys games, having the most polished combat, is somewhat tempered by the fact that you have to see it all multiple times to beat the game (one for each playable character).  On top of that, it's all set in a tower, so while you have a lot of variation in theme from floor to floor, it [i]is[/i] all in-doors.  This lends a sense of progression since you can quantify how much you're progressing through the tower, but it also leaves the game feeling, I dunno, claustrophobic compared to the outdoors settings in all the other games.  

This game continues the long Ys tradition of great OSTs--Genesis Beyond the Beginning being one of my stand-out favorites.  

If you've played any of the other Ys games and enjoyed them, Ys Origin is a no-brainer.  If you're looking to get into the series here, you can, but you'll be missing some obvious context, mainly from Ys 1 and 2, which this is a prequel to.  However, I'd say the story stands well enough on its own that you can get away with skipping those two (especially since their combat does not hold up well).

33555528.review:
Davvero un gioiellino, peccato per i problemi di compatibilità che mi hanno impedito di completarlo serenamente anche con gli altri due personaggi disponibili.

Pro:
+ Storia semplice ma coinvolgente, a seconda del personaggio che sceglierete, vedrete la storia sotto una diversa prospettiva.

+ Colonna sonora molto bella, adatta al gameplay frenetico

+ Gameplay molto veloce e divertente, potrete scegliere fra 3 personaggi con stili di combattimento diversi. Avrete a disposizione attacchi base, attacchi con salto (ascendente e discendente) e spell/skill di 3 tipi. Progredendo nel gioco sbloccherete sempre più potenziamenti che renderanno l'esperienza di gioco ancora più appagante e frenetica.

+ Boss di fine livello: UNO SPETTACOLO! Sono a un livello ben superiore di moltissimi rpg da me provati fino ad ora, sia moderni che non. Strategie di combattimento mai banali: vi capiterà di dovervi arrampicare sul boss, di dover evitare i suoi proiettili con visuale dall'alto stile bullet-hell, di doverlo combattere in un duello quasi alla pari o anche una combinazione di queste.

+ In generale il gioco mi ha dato l'impressione di avere un bilanciamento fra i vari parametri di difficoltà, exp guadagnata e danni molto coerente. La difficoltà è perfettamente ponderata e vi basterà dedicare  10-20 minuti/"istanza" all'uccisione di mostri per essere preparati ad un boss fight in cui vi dovrete preoccupare solo di capire la strategia corretta e metterla in atto.


+/- Level design decente, mappe non troppo grandi ma divertenti da esplorare con quei pochi tesori nascosti (ma non troppo).

Contro:
- Ho giocato per 2 giorni senza problemi ed al terzo (senza modificare nulla sul pc) il gioco crashava ai caricamenti. Non ho ancora trovato una soluzione che non necessiti riavvii e magia nera. Pensate che 7 delle 22 ore segnate al momento, sono dovute al gioco sempre aperto per non rischiare di non vederlo mai più ripartire.

A causa di questo GRAVISSIMO bug mi trovo costretto a rinunciare ad un'esperienza completa con gli altri due pg disponibili. 
ATTENZIONE per un utente medio che non ha molta dimestichezza con questo tipo di problemi il bug può risultare "terminale". Vi passerà ogni desiderio di continuare e sarete costretti ad abbandonarlo.

Concluedendo, non mi sento di sconsigliare il gioco per questo bug, se sarete fortunati potrete godervi un'esperienza fluida frenetica e piena di boss fantastici.

33446340.review:
Ys Origins is the 3rd game released on the "Napishtim" engine of Ys games, accomapnying Oath in Felghana, and Ark of Napishtim, but takes place before Ys 1 and 2, the first games in the series. I strongly recommend playing Ys 1 and 2 before you play Origins, as much of Origins is a complete retread of 1 and 2 to the point where it feels like a modern retelling of the story, for purposeful reasons. While the description of the game describes it asa "Metroidvania", it has ery little to do with the genre - there's very little backtracking save for 2 specific parts of the story, and the use of new skills is almost entirely 'going forward', rather than unlocking new parts of previosu content.

Ys Origins takes place 700 years before Ys 1 and 2, and tells the tale of three adventurers, Yunica, Hugo, and a 3rd unlockable, as they scale the Tower of Darm searching for the Goddesses, who have gone missing from Ys. Yunica and Hugo's stories are slightly different, and the game is short enough to where playing them both (and then the 3rd character, for the "Canon Story") is something that can be accomplished in about 20-25 hours of game time. If all you care about is the story, my recommendation is to play it in the order of Yunica -> Hugo -> 3rd Character, all on Very Easy or Normal, depending on your skill. If you're an achievement hunter or looknig to 100% the game, be aware that you'll be beating the game a minimum of 6 times, with 3 of those being on the hardest difficulty level, Nightmare. You'll also be doing side arena challenges and grinding them for extra, non story related, content. There's little reason to play difficulties between Very Easy, Normal, or Nightmare in my opinion - one for just experiencing the story, one for a standard challenge, and one to tear your hair out.

The art style and presentation is much the same as the rest of the Ys series: A bombastic, anime-styled tale full of dramatic adventure and magic, backed by orchestral and rock music that constantly keeps the game running at a full throttle energetic pace. Each section of the tower is themed with a new, vibrant tileset, so climbing the new sections of the mega dungeon feels different aesthetically. Returning fans of the series will find the game runs so much common ground with Ys 1 and 2 that oftentimes you'll know how to solve a puzzle or sidequest just from the presentation of it. The instant you get the Blue Necklace, you know what it's used for, and as soon as you see the Dreaming Idol, you know you're looking for something to slot into it, and so on. It's full of pleasant callbacks, as the entire game takes place within Darm's Tower, and on some level, feels like a modern remake of the second half of Ys 1.

Combat is still breakneck paced, and runs off the engine of the previous games. For those unaware, the Bump Combat system of the early Ys games was replaced by a button mashing swift attack and magic combo system, with no directly usable healing items. Healing items drop from killing enemies, as do strength, defense, and MP regen buffs. EXP earned also increases the longer your combo goes, and so combat entails you mad dashing from room to room, constantly hammering and crashing through foes to keep up your combo and buff meters. There is also a "Boost System" that ups your character's defenses and their magic powers, but doesn't directly buff their attack, making using it a matter of skill more than button mashing. The game works to keep you constantly engaged, and it accomplishes it magnificently. As you go through the game, you feel powerful, as skills level up and your own ability to plow effortlessly through mobs increases. The game also features SP you use to level up abilities outside of direct XP, things like decreasing MP cost for spells, increasing the boost meter recharge, increasing resists to statuses, and so on.

The two characters differ, both in story presentation and in combat. While the basics of the story are the same, the characters accomplish different goals, and NPCs are seen in a different light based on who you choose. The 3rd unlockable character's story is different in its entirety and features new bosses and content not seen in the other paths. Yunica Tovah is a magic-less knight who fights with a battleaxe (and later a Greatsword), similarly to Adol, the protagonist of the other games, and those familiar with Ys will find she's an easy fit. Hugo Fact is a magician who handles like a walking shmup character, firing blasts and lasers, sacrificing speed for range. His abilities are slighlty less straightforward than Yunica's, but having a spammed range attack option that pierces enemies in a Ys game makes the game so much easier it almost feels like cheating at times.

Bosses continue to be highlight encounters of the series, and test your pattern recognition and reaction speed in equal measure. I did not play on Nightmare, and have no desire to, but there are a few bosses who I can only assume would be absolutely maddening to go through. Yunica in general has a harder time with bosses due to being melee, and due to her block mechanism being a timed parry rather than an easy to put up forcefield - but it's not much of a difference, and you quickly find that Yunica can go completely hyper aggressive, using her guard parry to allow her to constantly stay in a boss's face with no fear whatsoever. In general I would say the expanded repertoire of the game makes the bosses in the Napishtim Engine games easier. I have not played Oath or Ark yet, so I unfortunately can't compare to those games, but from what I hear, those two games are more difficult in boss terms than Origins.

All in all, a story that explains the "Origins" of the series, coupled with a sterling presentation, and consistently fun, engaging gameplay, the Ys series continues to impress. It should be at the forefront of any action gamer's list to play, if they haven't already. With a wide range of difficulties to accomodate all skill levels, and a relatively short playtime per story, completing and learning everything is well within the grasp of even non-hardcore gamers who might otherwise be put off by the series' somewhat legendary difficulty levels among its more rabid fans.

33057119.review:
Ys Origin, is a fun game but it might not be for you.

The story is very cheesy, if you're into the typical jrpg story and dialog, you're in for a treat. The conversations were especially cheesy. I would not be able to finish the game if it were not for the playing aspects.

The game mechanics are simple, a mix between top down and side scroller, the game is actually 3D. Much of the game is linear, and you remain in a single tower for the entire game. Just going up, up, up.

It provides various difficulty settings, which is nice and may give you a second run through. The other option is to pick onw of the other charaters to play through, there are three.

The leveling system is nice and they do a good job here, making sure you can run into difficult enemies that later become easy due to your level.

There are items you can obtain that do special things, like avoid certain damage or have a physical mechanic.

The controls were simple, but I wish I could customize the controls a bit more and separate some of the actions from a single button. For instance they tie attack and confirm and this should be allowed to be broken out. There is one more thing that makes me mad and that is you can't jump after attacking right away and it just makes it feel clunky, where you can attack and avoid damage appropriately.

Graphics a clean, colorful and nice to look at. Still old school and simple, but they do an okay job with animations. The sprites are not 3D, they have several poses depending on the direction your facing. This means they are flat, but that's okay for me at least.

Music is typical of these genres, Some electric guitar and fast past background noise. Not by any means memorible.

There are several bosses as you climb the levels of the tower, each level is pretty short but the leveling aspect takes a bit longer, so you do have to level grind a bit, going back a forth between enemies to boost the return of exp.

There a temp buffs that boost states and exp. Enemies drop this. There are no consumable items for healing or cure, all of them are used instant on pickup. Buffs are the same way so you need to kill enemies fast to keep buffs.

None of the bosses were particularly challenging to solve their weakness. Last boss was a bit, but it's pretty much just magic and attack. Timing plays a part and figuring out the enmies attack pattern.

I played the game on Hard from the get go so the challenge is what kept me going. Not sure if I would have continued if it were easy, since the story is so cheesy.

I purchased this for cheap, couple bucks. I wouldn't pay more the that, since there are many go titles in the ball park. But than I guess my top limit is like $25 for any game. I wait for the deep sales.

Overall, recommend, if on sale or it's price is only a few dollars.

32836885.review:
I'm ashamed to say that this is my first Ys game. I've had Ys III for years but never got around to playing it. After BoneSnapDeez and Exhuminator, two of my friends from the Racketboy forums, recommended Ys Origin to me as a good entry point for the series, I figured I'd take their advice and give it shot considering that I had it in my Steam library already. I've played a lot of games on recommendations, but this is probably the best recommendation I've ever gotten for a game.

Ys Origin is a very approachable action RPG, and it's a damn good one at that. It offers five different difficulties, making it a good romp for veteran players as well as a non-threatening entry point for new players. You get to play as one of two different characters (three once you've cleared the game once), and while I only played through as one (axe chick ftw), my understanding is that the main plot of the game is largely the same between the two with minor perspective details differing - certainly worth playing through with all characters if you want every side to the story but not different enough that you NEED to play through the game three times to get the Ys lore.

I'll try not spoil anything, but the basic plot of the game is that the two goddesses of Ys have vanished from the magical floating temple where all the humans live without a trace down to the surface which has been overrun by and infested with demons for the past a lot of years. Your character - whichever of the two you pick - accompanies a search party of mages and knights to the surface on a mission to find and protect the goddesses. The game itself takes place entirely within a giant towers that the demons erected to try to reach and/or rival the magical floating shrine place.

The visuals are charming, and the soundtrack is superb. Honestly, the game is worth playing through just for an excuse to listen to the music. The narrative is delivered entirely through subtitles - no voice acting - so there are no aggravating voices to interrupt the bitching music. My only real gripe with the entire game is a minor technical problem - the aspect ratio. I played on Steam, so I don't know if the regular PC release is any more cooperative, but I could not for the life of me figure out how to get the aspect ratio set to 16:9 instead of 4:3 (assuming there is a way at all). I know it's not the end of the world, but I was playing on my Steam Link on my giant living room TV, and the huge (or, as our president-elect says, yuge) black bars on the sides got irritating. Aside from that, though, this game is about as flawless as I can imagine any action RPG being.

Ys Origin is not a long game - it took me about 10 hours to clear - but I think that the length is actually pretty solidly in the Goldilocks zone for this game. It's not so short that it feels like it's over in the blink of an eye, but it also doesn't drag on and on and on and on like a lot of RPGs start to. It lasts long enough to tell a story, get you involved in it, offer some compelling and satisfying challenges, and then let you on your way. Speaking of satisfaction, the most satisfying part of the game for me was definitely the boss battles. The bosses in Ys Origin - and in Ys games in general, from what I've been told - are all a matter of figuring out the "key" so to speak to victory. You can't just rush a boss and blindly start hacking at it and expect to win (unless you're ridiculously overpowered, I guess). You have to take note of a boss's attacks, look for possible weak spots, and find out how to exploit those weakness while taking as little damage as possible, and it will often take an attempt or two to figure out how to win. I was only able to beat three of the game's bosses in one attempt (ironically, though, those were the last three bosses of the game, but I'd powered up the strongest armor and maxed out my weapon upgrades as well as being a pretty high level, so I think I might have been a smidge OP by that point).

Ys Origin is not without its flaws....but those flaws are very, very few and very, very far between. Those used to super long RPGs may be left wanting at the end of Ys Origin, but for those of us who like to get a story and move on to the next story, the length is perfect, and for those of you who enjoy longer games, the three playable characters offer roughly 30 to 40 hours of gameplay for you. Ys Origin is, in my mind, as close to a perfect action RPG as I've ever played, and I look forward to collecting and playing the rest of the series.

32136425.review:
This is the game that made me realize that action RPGs are my favourite game genre. 

Short version: Just buy it. It's worth the money.

Long version: One of my favourite games of all times. Here is why.

+ Three different characters which gives the game a high replay value since the storyline, combat and dialogue is completely different, especially with the third character you unlock after completition. 
+ Music is absolutely amazing, but that is something that all Ys games have in common.
+ Challenging in a good way. The game does not hold your hand. 
+ One of few games that actually made me cry because of a NPC death. 
+ Satisfying hack-and-slash-ish combat (bullet hell with one of the characters) with different spells. Simple and not complex at all, which is nice. 
+ Design wise the game looks good, it fits the game.
+ Bosses are cool.

+/- Story is a bit meh but aRPGs are not exactly famous for having fantastic story lines so personally I don't have any issue with it.

But all good things have some downsides...

- Linear and doesn't give you much option.
- Sometimes combat gets a bit stale since you only have three spells plus your normal weapon attacks.
- The game is quite short and it feels even shorter after a few playthroughs.
- Don't play 86 hours on keyboard if you don't like pain. You will use your left hand. A lot.

After playing this, go ahead and play Ys I and Ys II and realize this game is nothing in difficulty in comparision. ;)

32036011.review: Great replay value. Three separate stories that take place in the same area, but they are all connected. The gameplay is more fleshed out when compared to Felghana, and the story is good as well. Farming is important for at least Hugo, and Yunica for a smooth experience (Not too much farming though). Toal's playthrough is designed well, but be extra prepared for the final encounter. Other than that, the combat is fantastic, the story is quite good, and the graphics are fantastic in many cases. I highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a good time.

31682896.review:
It's a darn good game, it's reminicent of the Ark of nepishtim in art and gameplay to a certain degree but it feel's a lot less brutal with the environment as that installment of YS, by which I mean the near impossible jumps with no clue as to how to extend your jumps, this game is filled with fantastic music, fun fast gameplay mechanics and a decent variety of way's to play with a total of three playable characters in the long run who all play dramatically different dood. 

It has a decent amount of story which held my interest from start to finish with each character, it's not super hard but not easy so the gameplay is satisfying there too, if you are looking for a fun adventure game to whittle your hours away with and rock out to some really nice soundtrack's then I highly suggest this game, even going through on the other playthrough's and fighting the same bosses (which is a negative granted) is fun due to the variety of the other characters fighting styles and change of tactics dood. 

As a final note for fans of the other games, you do not play as Adol in this game but instead three other characters who as far as I am aware unless I missed something have nothing to do with Adol either, if you do buy this game (as a result of my haphazard review no less) I hope ya all enjoy it dood's. :D

31482269.review:
Klasse.
Ys Origin ist ein absolut brilliantes kleines Spiel.
Den Großteil der Zeit verbringt man mit Hack & Slay, immer den Turm weiter nach oben. Ganze Monsterhorden werden mittels Angriffen, Spezialangriffen und Magie in Windwseile in Loot verwandelt. Die Monster sind dabei vielfältig und oft gegen bestimmte Schadensarten besonders anfällig. Von riesigen Rittern, deren großer Schild alle Angriffe von vorne abblockt bis zu fliegenden irgendwas, die Monster sind abwechslungsreich und mitunter sogar anspruchsvoll.
Konterpunkt stellen die Bosskämpfe dar. Sie sind anspruchsvoll und man muss die Taktiken der Bosse verinnerlichen. Im richtigen Moment springen, im richtigen Moment zurückgehen, wer einfach reinrennt, stirbt. Manche Bosse sind derart anspruchsvoll, dass man Stunden damit verbringen kann sie zu legen, ich persönlich kam mir aber nie betrogen vor, sondern ärgerte mich über meine eigenen Fehler.
Wem Ys Origin mal zu schwer erscheint, der findet im Levelsystem eine einfache Möglichkeit es sich leichter zu machen. Ist ein Boss mit Level 23 zu schwer, kann es schon helfen einfach bis Level 24 einfache Monster umzuhauen und schon verursacht man selber mehr Schaden am Boss. Man sollte jedoch nicht vergessen zu speichern, denn Ys Origin tut es nicht für den Spieler. Oldscool.
Etwas Kritik: Leider lässt sich die Schwirigkeit nicht im Spiel, sondern nur am Anfang des Spiels, einstellen. Wer 4h gespielt hat und Partout den Boss nicht schafft hätte hier vielleicht gerne eine Alternative. Auch ist das Spiel ziemlich linear. Letzter Kritikpunkt: Japanische Spiele muss man mögen. Götter die von Menschen gefangen genommen werden? Gehört zur Story, als hört gefälligst auf zu fragen warum! Ach ja, und warum die kleine Pelzige Kreatur in der Ecke die mächtigste Robe im Spiel hat? WEIL HALT!
Erwähnen sollte ich noch den guten und stimmungsvollen Soundtrack und die teils brilliante Artwork in den Zwischensequenzen.
Ach ja, das Spiel lässt sich mit drei grund verschiedenen Charakteren spielen. Ritter, Zauberer und  Hakentyp. Da jeder eine eigene Story hat ermunter das extrem stark zum erneuten durchspielen.
Man sollte aber einen Controller ein Eigen nennen, mit der Tastatur ist das Spiel ziemlich hart.
Fazit: Eine Perle. Brilliant. Wirklich gut.

No lo niego y desde esta persepctiva se puede saber de que mi análisis es, porque me encantan los juegos RPG/Aventura de aspecto isométrico. Y esto es eso exactamente es lo que es. 

La historia se ve desde la perspectiva de almenos 3 personajes (tal vez 4). Bueno yo no juegué con los otros dos solamente con Yunica. 

El juego se trata de un par de diosas que escapan con una perla después de que el templo fue subido al cielo por culpa de los demonios y una torre que salió. Y la misión de uno es recuerarlas. 

Yunica es una caballera (suena raro) que tiene tres habilidades de ataques que cambian, brinca, y tiene equipamiento y un sistema de nivelajes de habilidades pasivas. 

La historia no es tan buena pero por lo menos tiene escenas en animé y también buenos jefes y otras características que lo hace interesante, lo único es que subir de nivel hace las cosas totalmente más fácil. 

Se los recomiendo

8/10

30792128.review:
Bu oyunu indirimdeki oyunlara bakarken gördüm ve iyiki de almışım diyorum.

Öncelikle şunu belirteyim.Ben serinin diğer oyunlarını daha oynamadım ama bu oyun ilk oyun değil.Fakat bu konuda endişelenmeyin.Çünkü bu oyun,serinin ilk oyunundan 700 yıl önce geçiyormuş.Bu yüzden hikayeyi anlama konusunda en ufak bir sıkıntınız olmayacaktır.

Oyunda oynanabilecek 3 karakter var.(3. karakter oyunu diğer 2 karakterden herhangi biriyle bitirdikten sonra açılıyor) Bu karakterlerin hikayeleri ve karşılaştıkları bossların bazılarının farklı olması sebebiyle oyunu birden çok kez bitirmek isteyebilirsiniz.Özellikle son açılan karakteri denemenizi tavsiye ederim çünkü hikayesi diğer 2 karaktere kıyasla çok farklı.

Ben şahsen oyunu Yunica karakteri ile bitirdim,şimdi de yeni açılan 3. karakterle oynamaktayım.Oyunu bir karakterle bitirmek 10 saatten fazla zaman alıyor ve oyunu bitirdikten sonra Boss rush gibi birkaç mod da açılıyormuş ama daha denemedim onları.Kısacası oyunu komple bitirmek istiyorsanız oyun size oldukça uzun bir gameplay sunuyor ve muhtemelen ben de tüm karakterlerle bitirip diğer modları da oynarım diye düşünüyorum.

Oyunun oynanışına geçelim.Oyunda devasa bir kule içerisindesiniz,ve bu kulede ilerliyorsunuz.Kulenin bazı bölümlerinde heykeller bulunmakta ve bu noktalarda oyunu save edebilir ve upgrade alabilirsiniz.Ayrıca bir kez aktif ettiğiniz heykele istediğiniz zaman teleport edebilirsiniz.

Oyunun oynanışı seri olmakla birlikte karşılaştığınız canavar çeşitliliği tatmin edici.Sadece görüntü anlamında bahsetmiyorum.Uçan olsun,uzaktan size saldıran olsun,arkadan size yapışıp koşu hızınızı yavaşlatarak canınızı emen olsun,yere dengenizi bozan bir sıvı atan olsun çeşitli çeşitli canavarlar var.

Ama bu oyunun en büyük artısı boss savaşları.Her boss'un birbirinden farklı saldırı çeşitleri bulunmakta,ve çoğu boss'a direkt olarak damage vuramıyorsunuz.Boss savaşları gerçekten zorlayıcı ve bossları yenebilmek için bossların mekaniklerini iyice anlamanız gerekmekte.Buna rağmen aynı boss'ta uzun bir süre takılabilirsiniz.Bu durumda son save'inize dönüp birkaç level atlayarak boss'a yeniden meydan okuyabilirsiniz.Her boss'dan önce save point olması bu durumu sizin için kolaylaştırmakta.

Önceden de dediğim gibi 3 oynanabilir karakter var.Bunlardan biri elinde baltası olan yakın menzilli savaşçı olan Yunica.İleride bir tane uzak menzil için de kulllanabileceğiniz saldırısı açılmakta ve oynaması oldukça zevkli.Bir diğeri ise uzak menzilli büyücümüz Hugo.Bu karakteri pek denemediğim için çok bir yorum yapamayacağım.Ve bir de oyunu bitirdikten sonra açılan karakterimiz var.Bu karakter hakkında spoiler vermek istemiyorum ama oynanışı çok seri ve yakın menzilli bir karakter.

Oyunun başka bir artısı da müzikleri.Siz sever misiniz bilmiyorum ama bu oyunun müzikleri gerçekten oyuna zevk katıyor.

Oyunun çizim tarzı da gerçekten hoşuma gitti.Oyunun Steam'deki videosunu izlerseniz görebilirsiniz.Çizimleri çok detaylı değil ama bu tarz bir oyun için tam da olması gereken çizim tarzı diye düşünüyorum.Eğer çizimleri daha iyi olsaydı oyun aynı keyfi vermezdi diyebilirim.

Oyunda tek eksi diyebileceğim şey level ve eşya sistemi.Oyunda level atladıkça statlarınız otomatik artıyor yani stat dağıtma gibi bir durum söz konusu değil.Oyundaki tüm eşyaları da oyunda bulacağınız kutulardan falan almaktasınız.Yani silah satın alma veya craftlama gibi bir durum yok.Ama buna da tam eksi diyemem çünkü bu sayede oyunun oynanışına daha çok konsantre olabiliyorsunuz.

İncelememi bitirmeden şuna da değinmek isterim.Oyunda bazen gözden kaçırdığınız eşyalar olabiliyor veya ne yapmanız gerektiğini bulamayabiliyorsunuz.Bu tarz durumlarda ingilizceniz iyiyse bu yazıdan yardım alabilirsiniz;

It's a great game with difficulty settings that should suit most people; from casuals up to the more hardcore action gamers. Story is not revolutionary but servicable.

30363362.review:
+ The music is really good, particularly the boss music. You will be hearing a lot of that.
+ It's like a mostly-2D cutesy Dark Souls.
+ Controls are mostly very tight, the only weird thing I noticed was sometimes accidentally firing a second skill after using a charged skill. If you get hit, it's probably your fault.
+ Bosses are all sufficiently unique that it feels good to die to them over and over again until you learn their patterns and beat them into the ground.
- Level scaling and equipment levels' effects are ridiculous. It seems like either the designers or programmers didn't know how much damage a boss should do or take. After spending ten minutes grinding a few levels or finding weapon or armour upgrades, a boss can go from doing 20 damage a hit and taking 50 a hit to doing 8 damage and taking 100. It doesn't take that long to grind, but it's make-work and is frustrating when you just want to beat the shit out of the boss on a balanced playing field. It also feels pretty lame when you enter a new area and are suddenly doing 1 damage a hit to enemies that look almost identical to the ones you have been pulping before.
- No auto/turbofire function for Hugo, the projectile-spamming character. I gave up on him after an hour when I decided damaging my hands was not worth it. 
- Puzzles are mostly formulaic and consist of find x item and bring it to y location. Potentially cool stuff like the Mask of Eyes which lets you see and interact with hidden objects while blinding you to living creatures is used only a few times in the entire game.
- Plot is completely ignorable. Villains like power, heroes like the power of friendship. News at ten.

30040688.review: If you are a fan of aRPG's, this is a must have. To be honest, to me it doesn't look like much with the RPGMaker style graphics, but don't be fooled. As a fan of hack and slash, and already owning many great jRPG's I would have completely overlooked this one if not for the great price on a STEAM sale and such positive feedback. The story and characters are quite adorable. The tower is well laid out, simple small maps for each level/story, yes it feels like a dungeon crawler,but technically its a tower. In which you start your adventure at the base of the tower searching for 2 princesses. Music is really well done, animations etc, just exceptional, a really cute fun game. Technically as an aRPG fan this game is well worth full price, but if you are like me and have a large back log of great games, it comes on sale for a few dollars now and then. For a few dollars this one is a no brainer, as a casual and value gamer this one is a steal of a deal. Do not miss this one! Probably the cutest aRPG I own. Yes i say aRPG, it really doesn't feel like a jRPG to me honestly. Mostly because when the game starts, the story telling is in French(I am pretty sure) and English dubbed. Some may not like the unskippable cutscenes, especially if you have already had one playthrough, I personally am not really a fan of visual novels either but once the gameplay actually starts up, its not that bad or as long of cut scenes, but I do agree there should be some sort of skip/next button.

30030009.review:
Let me start off with saying I own Ys III for the SNES but other than that game of the series, this is my first time really sitting down and playing an Ys game.  I am someone who loves games such as dark souls to sword of mana and this game feels a little like both This game is great if you like any action-RPG elements, but it does have some kinks and gimmicks that are a little off puting at times.. I will keep this as short as I can and layout the pros/cons and give a summarization.

Pros:
-The graphics in this game are great with lots of detail in most areas
-You will level up fast and find that enemies will never be to overpowered 
-The music in the game is fantastic and will usually not get too dull
-Bosses are great, fun to fight and great music with them too
-The story is decent although a little cliche
-New players to the series will feel welcomed and don't need to play the others to understand whats going on

Cons:
-Collecting all ore in order to power your weapons is necessary, bosses will be to strong if you miss 2 or more later in game
-There are some cheap deaths in the game such as having a certain item equipped will kill you instantly if you don't already know about it, or a certain boss will be able to trap you (unfairly) and you will take massive damage with no way to regain health during the fight.
-The game doesn't give that well explanations on what items do and whether you need to equip them or not in order to use them (some are passive with no explanation of it)
-Mid to late game you will start to see enemies from the early game that are just stronger than before (hp and strength,  some aquire new moves too)
-Weapons are pretty bland and basic for Yunica, not sure about the other two characters.

Although I go into detail about the cons, I found that I really liked and enjoyed the game and will continue to play it with new characters to see what the difference is between them and update this review once I have done so. I do also plan to play the other games of the series because I do love this type of gameplay/story. For now I will rate the game a 8 out of 10. Although I found that there wasn't much variety in the weapons and even though there were some cheap deaths, the game kept me engaged and not want to quit for hours at a time.

(Muito boa por sinal). Aqui você jogará com 3 protagonistas, Yunica, Hugo e The Claw. Cada, terá o papel de mostrar um pouco dos  lados da trama, e do universso do jogo. Mesmo sendo 3 personagens na mesma trama, os finais se contradizem, isso para os 2 personagens jogáveis desde o inicio, e para min o real final fica com o terceiro, The Claw, disponivel após finalizar a campanha com ambos os primeiros (Para o entender do enredo, há necessida de um conhecimento básico em ingles, nada muito complicado.). Este jogo tem uma dificuldade bem alta, ótimo para quem gosta de desafios e aquela sensação de recompensa após derrotar aquele boss complicado todavia, existem dificuldades para serem  escolhidas de acordo com seu nível, fácil, normal, difícil e pesadelo. Comprindo "lindamente' com seu papel de Action-RPG, é um otimo jogo para os iniciantes da franquia, como para aqueles que ja desfrutaram da maldade de Dark Fact. E claro seria um pecado deixar de falar dessa maravilha que é a OST deste jogo, musicas pra la de épicas.

29651394.review:
曾经有一位乡村姑娘因为迷路不小心来到了女神宫，结识了伊苏的双子女神，并与她们达成了一个约定——成为神殿骑士，保护珍爱之人。“我生来便不会使用魔法，所以在很小的时候，我就决心要做一名骑士，成为和父亲一样的骑士，永远守护两位女神”，这是这位小姑娘在表达初心时留下的内心独白，她叫尤妮卡，出生于神官托霸世家，当双子女神一声不响地神秘失踪时，她以一位见习骑士的身份自告奋勇地加入了女神搜索队之中。

或许是因为无法使用魔法的天生残缺，尤妮卡很早就锻炼了一颗坚强之心。身为神殿骑士团团长之女，她在确认父亲战死的消息后没有表现出一丝的沮丧，而是提高了继承托霸之位的觉悟；当萨芭对自己的不幸身世加以讽刺时，她没有因此扰乱心神，而是一鼓作气地攻下了关押女神的拉朵之塔。

正值豆蔻年华之际，尤妮卡也保持着一颗妙龄少女的童真之心。在申请入团时，她写下了前无古人，后无来者的志愿理由“因为喜欢蕾雅大人和菲娜大人”；当玛莎被五只魔物包围时，她可以义愤填膺地脱口而出“你们居然围攻一个女生”；遇见萨乌尔的魂体后，她会像个孩子一样情不自禁地失声痛哭“父亲是个笨蛋笨蛋笨蛋”。

就是这么一位时而快乐、时而愤怒、时而悲伤的小丫头，也曾遭遇过青春期的莽撞和迷惘。在她得知奇修迦尔是她的杀父仇人时，愤怒的情绪充斥了整个大脑，一时的冲动让她尝到了鲁莽行事的苦头；当她眼睁睁地看着救下自己的女神菲娜被暗之一族掳走的时候，她的自责和自卑一度让她一蹶不振。

不过和那些多愁善感的少男少女不同，尤妮卡懂得让自己走出怅惘，懂得找回当初的那颗坚强之心。一次又一次的斩妖除魔成就了她的觉悟和器量，青梅竹马的舍己牺牲也没有阻挠她前进的步伐，尤妮卡谨记着父亲的教诲，以内心坚守的武道战胜了堕入魔道的杀父仇家，以合众的光明之力打败了暗之一族的最强魔道师，她会在伊苏的大地上永远陪伴着长眠的女神，她会用自己的实际行动来证明即使不会使用魔法，她也能够做到像其他魔道师那样优秀，因为她有着可以代替魔法的力量。

29617098.review:
Easily one of my favorite games on Steam.  

I noticed some other reviewers saying that you shouldn't play this game if you haven't played other Ys games.  I don't agree: previous to this I think maybe I had played Wanderers from Ys (SNES) briefly and I had probably played 5-10 hours into Ys VI (PS2).  I think I got this on a Daily Deal, but it's worth paying full price.  The dungeons are beautiful, the music is spectacular, the action is superb.  I prefer this to Oath in Felghana or Ark of Napishtim - both great games, but I thought this had more charm.  Granted there aren't any towns, which is a departure, but I think pure dungeon crawling works well for this series.

29474282.review:
Pros:
Good soundtrack
Neat hack 'n slash gameplay
Good story overall
Older magic spells are never rendered obsolete (this was a problem with some other Ys games)
Difficult game

But...

Cons:
Mandatory grinding-- ergo, a badly balanced game.
Some accessory equipment was extremely underused
I got killed instantly (9999 damage) in the sand area with no warning because I had a specific item selected
Very little variety in the environment, as you're inside a tower the whole time
Very little in the way of conveyance during boss fights
Pausing is disabled during boss fights
Predictable plot elements
Most treasure chests are not optional. At several points, the game will not progress until you've found a specific item. This makes the chests feel less rewarding, since you were required to find them.

29422496.review:
Un juegazo sin lugar a dudas. Ys Origin es un juego RPG de acción en tiempo real en el cual podremos seleccionar entre 3 personajes para realizar la historia, los cuales tienen diferentes sistemas de combate y habilidades, así como modificaciones en la trama que nos hara enterarnos un poco más de la historia así como de los personajes que salen en ella. 

Ys Origin además posee una banda sonora desde mi punto de vista espectacular, lo que nos hara disfrutar más de las horas de juego que le echemos, las cuales no son pocas, ya que disfrutando de todos los personajes y extras que trae el juego (contiene un modo de vs contra los jefes y otro de arena contra oleada de bichos) podemos llegar facilmente a las 20+ horas.

Dicho todo esto como unico inconveniente a señalar, al menos un poco para mi, es que el juego está unicamente en ingles, y por Internet no pude encontrar ningun pack de traducción, por lo que si el ingles es un problema para vosotros y sigue sin haber pack de traducción entonces no lo recomendaria, ya que personalmente pienso que el juego se disfruta al maximo enterandote de toda la trama y dialogos. Pero si sois unos maestros del inglés, palante que disfrutareis con este juegazo!

29376950.review:
I'd say this is the best Ys 6 engine game we have on Steam, as far as gameplay mechanic goes. It has (I think) the most bosses, it also has the best bosses, its dungeon is really well-designed for the most part, and the action got even further refinement from Oath in Felghana. There are two problems however. Having three character is nice, but having to play three times is not nice, especially when considering the dungeon design stay more or less the same. And when that third and hidden character's story is the "truth," it means you have to play it at least twice to get the actual story.

So it actually comes down to how much into Ys you are. I do not recommend this to people who are going into Ys for the first time; it's not a good reflection of how Ys series actually work, because it's a game entirely based on dungeon-crawling. Not only that, the storytelling is more similar to Trails series than Ys series (same scenario writer), so you have to be fine with crap-ton of dialogues.

If you like Ys 6 and Felghana, you can just play it once as Yunica to feel satisfied with its mechanics, because it's one hell of a tight ARPG, but really, the game wants you to have played Ys 1 and Ys 2 before playing this. The level design, story, characters, background music, they are all designed around the fact this is a prequel to Ys 1 and Ys 2, and the game doesn't shy away from making that connection.

But to be honest, if you've played Ys 1 and Ys 2 and have fond memories of it, Ys Origin has such a good story that gets to you in so many ways. There are so many subtle connections to Ys 1 and Ys 2, and a lot of them add a lot of emotions to those games retrospectively. You get to understand its lore better, a few of its characters better, and you get to understand why and how things came to be when Adol first got washed ashore on Esterian beach in Ys 1. It's dependant on whether you have played those games or not, so it's not recommended to everyone, but if you have, this is a must.

29283194.review:
If you don't want to read:

Pros: 
-Very enjoyable characters
-3 different playable characters, with completely different character mechanics AND unique storyline for each character!
-Beautiful storyline, such that I just sat and stared at my screen when it was over and contemplated life
-Variety of difficulty modes - bosses gain new moves and effects at higher difficulties, not just increased stats
-Nightmare Difficulty is REALLY hard (nice for those like me who are tired of really easy games)
-Combat system is very strategic and engaging, and you will need to pull out all your moves at various stages in the game
-Quite possibly the best soundtrack in any game I have ever played, INCLUDING FINAL FANTASY 7, 8, 9, AND 10 (though 10 especially would be close)

Con: 
-Unfortunately you can't skip dialogue. Not a huge deal if you're just doing "regular" playthroughs, because each story is pretty unique and there isn't much overlap. Where this gets annoying is if you're going for the Steam achievements where you have to beat the "unbeatable" bosses, because you have to reset the game every time you fail and go through the dialogue again, because dying doesn't trigger "retry" option. 


Ys Origin is one of those games that I wish I could go back in time and experience all over again. I picked this gem up a few years ago on a whim, and wow. W-O-W. From the combat to the characters to the classic-but-heart-wrenching story, this game delivers on all fronts. The story is beautifully unveiled, as you can play through with three different characters (one unlockable after beating the game with either one of the starting characters), and each one tells a different story, so you have to beat all three playthroughs to get the full story, and there is a special last boss that is only available on the secret character. (as well as a special ending sequence) What makes this great is that each character plays completely differently, so in addition to having new story content you have a completely new playstyle to learn, which especially affects the boss fights. Personally I chose axe-girl (yunica) --> mage (hugo) --> secret character, and I would recommend playing through in that order, because Hugo is a little OP so you spoil yourself if you start with him, and the secret character reveals all the secret details of the story so it's best to do last. 

From the moment I picked the game up I couldn't put it down, grinding my way through 3 nightmare playthroughs (yes I'm insane), and completing the challenges for beating the bosses that are supposed to be too hard for you to beat. (You know those bosses that are supposed to kick your ass in the storyline, where you're supposed to beat them the next time you fight them? Well you *can* beat them for a steam achievement, although it only changes a few lines of dialogue, and they are FRIGGEN HARD). I had many moments on my first playthrough that had me screaming and raging at the screen as I started my 15th, 20th, or even 30th attempt at a specific boss. I chose nightmare mode to be challenged, and it doesn't disappoint. But even with the frustration of getting my @$$ kicked repeatedly, the combat was so good, and the story was so engaging that I kept coming back for more. 

One thing that I think is very cool is that the bosses actually gain new moves and effects as you increase the difficulty, rather than just stat boosts. I only played on nightmare but if you want to play through on a lower difficulty first, the fight will be different when you up the slider, which is excellent design. 

The game was so good that I instantly went out and bought all the other Ys games on Steam. Unfortunately, I fell a little bit TOO in love with the characters in Origin, and was saddened that I wouldn't be able to play them again in the other games (because Origin is set 700 years prior to the rest of the series). That combined with the fact that I was uncertain if I wanted to play the (very) old Ys1&2, but not wanting to play the games out of order, meant I didn't end up playing any of the others! At least, until now. I can gladly say that I have started the series back up, having completed I and am currently almost done with II, and am enjoying them very much. So I thought I would come back and write a review for the game that sucked me into this amazing series, and here we are! Hope everyone enjoys it as much as I have.

28951316.review:
"Let me tell you a story of the beginning.....Of Ys"
Set 700 years before the events of Ys 1 and 2 we venture to the destroyed world of Ys by an unknown force of demons.
Days pass as the remaining survivers atop a floting island that they sent to escape the scorge of demons on the earth known as "Solomun Shrine" the 2 Goddesses that watch over the people of Ys Reah and Feena have disappeard along with the source of magic in the world of Ys "The Black Pearl"
A group is dispatched to search for the godesses on the earth but are soon separated by an unknown force that attacked them on the way down from a tower that showed up out of nowhere.
Shortly after regrouping the search party begins to climb the mysterious tower in search of their godesses only to find much more afoot the tower that awaits them.
Unlike most Ys games where you plays as the title character "Adol the red" Ys origin gives us 3 different characters all together to play as.
Yunica Tova: A young girl and Dauther of the Captain in Gaurd command that protect the godesses, She wields a small battle axe and is a "less mobile" Adol if you are familier with the other games.
Hugo Fact: A mage in search of his missing brother and seeks to achieve great power, He wields "The Eyes of Fact" making Hugo the first Mage character to be playable in an Ys game as unlike Adol or anyone else he uses projectiles to fight from long range.
Toal Fact: Hugo's older brother and was once a commander of the Gaurd for protecting the goddesses, Now a half-demon Toal's Action's seem questionable at first as he as sided with the enemy to achieve great power as well...or does he? (Unlockable only after beating the game once as Yunica or Hugo, Note: His story is the actual cannon to the series)
Ys origin uses the same Ys engine that began with Ys VI and later improved in "Oath in Felghana" and as its own game and prequel story it holds quite well. Areas are broken to floors as you are climbing up the tower but variety exists as each floor as its own theme (Water, Sand, Fire ect) and its not just going up stairs upwards as they spice of the areas giving you places to explore for goodies and what not. However despite the variety in areas unlike other games in the series Origin is very linear in where you can and can't go to with only a very small bits of Exploring later down the line. There's also not that many Intresting characters to meet as most of them are either from the search party or the Villains of the game limiting the feel of a living world like previous games.
Despite those small down parts Ys origin is still fun and challenging game like all other Ys games in the series.
One small problem that kind of annoyed me is the Checkpoint systume. unlike the two eariler Ys games using this engine (Ys 6 and Oath in Felghana) if you die in an area/room you will restart from the start of that room and you can go back to a previous area if you are low on HP however Ys origin doesn't do that and instend your only means of checkpoints our the Goddess Statues that let you save the game/buy upgrades.
Which means if you died a along ways through an area without getting to the next Statue its all the way back to the previous one, And while you can Teleport back to one at any point to save any progress you made (I.E points or Key story items) you still have to go all the way back to the last point you got to which on later Difficulties can get on your nerves sometimes.
But if you've played any Ys game before and tried to beat it on Nightmare mode you should be pretty used to the pain and suffering by now. :P

28773571.review:
Ys Origin is a highly entertaining ARPG that let's you slice, smash, and burn your ways through demons floor after floor. The first Ys game as far as the lore background of the series is concerned, Ys Origin takes place several hundred years before the events of the first game and portrays several issues that have only been mentioned by name or entirely left in the dark in the previous Ys games.

In the game's main mode, you can choose one of two (later three) heroes to reach the top of a mysterious demonic tower in pursuit of two goddesses. Though the game mechanics and the tower itself are identical for all characters, each plays a bit differently - Yunica is a fairly tough melee fighter with useful area of attack special abilities, while Hugo is a range-centric mage with a strong standard attack and largely defensive skills. The third, unlockable character finally is goes full rogue, being capable of dishing out lots of damage in close combat yet also sharing Hugo's fragile nature.

Unless you plan to start in nightmare mode right away, the difficulty of the game generally is reasonable. Trash mobs typically do not pose much of a challenge unless you are seriously underleveled (and this problem can be solved with a bit of grinding), but the boss fights more than often will take you multiple tries to find the right strategy. Fortunately, this rarely becomes frustrating, not to the least because the game's fantastic soundtrack is one hell of a motivating factor.

Story-wise, the game is okay-ish. Though Ys Origins does answer lots of questions propped open by the earlier games, two of the three playable character follow the old "THE POWER OF FRIENDSHIP(tm)" plotline, with daddy issues galore. Ys Origins certainly has its moments, the plot will become fairly predictable if you've ever played a JRPG before



Despite of its minor flaws, Ys Origin still is a more than decent ARPG and one of the better parts in the Ys series.

เปิดตำนานซีรีย์ Ys ( อ่านว่า อีส นะครับ อย่าบ้านนอกแบบผมที่อ่านว่า วาย เอส มาโดยตลอด T_T ) อีกครั้ง โดยภาคนี้เราไม่ได้รับบทเป็นตา Adol หัวแดงแต่อย่างไร แต่เราได้รับบทเป็นถึง 3 ตัวละครได้แก่ อัศวินฝึกหัดผู้มีปมด้อยใช้เวทมนต์ไม่ได้ Yunica Tova (เธอมักโดนดูถูกเรื่องการใช้เวทมนต์) กับ จอมเวทอัจฉริยะ Hugo Fukt ผู้มีปมด้อยด้านอารมณ์จนเพื่อนในทีมบอกว่าเกิดมามึงเคยขำไหมว่ะ และตัวละครสุดท้ายที่ต้องเคลียร์ฉากจบใดจบหนึ่งใน 2 ตัวละครแรก ระดับความยากใดก็ได้คือ Majin Thor หรือ มนุษย์มาร ธอร์ ( ยังไม่รู้รายละเอืยดตัวละครนี้มากนักเพราะยังไม่ได้เล่น แต่ได้หาข้อมูลมานิดหน่อยว่าหากเล่นตัวละครตัวนี้จบจะเป็นการจบแบบ True Ending คือ เป็นการไปต่อยังภาคแรกที่ตา Adol เรือแตกมาโผล่อาณาจักร Ys นั้นแหละ และ Thor ยังเป็นเจ้าของดาบเงินที่ปักอยู่ที่ต้น Roda อีกด้วย หรือ ต้นไม้ภาคแรกที่ตา Adol แกไปเอาดาบเงินมานั้นแหละ )

28226983.review:
Gelungener Dungeon-Crawler Spin-off, aber nicht so gut wie die Hauptserie

Ys Origin macht sehr viel Spaß und trägt den Namen Ys mit Würde. Die Kämpfe sind so schnell und actionreich wie von der Serie gewohnt und die epischen Bosskämpfe überzeugen mühelos. Darüber hinaus bietet dieser Spin-off sogar einige Verbesserungen gegenüber der Hauptserie. So gibt es hier drei spielbare Hauptcharaktere, welche allesamt ihre eigene Persönlichkeit mitbringen und sich sogar vernünftig artikulieren können. Da kann Adol noch was von denen lernen.^^ Allerdings sollte man sich bewusst machen, dass man es hier mit einem Dungeon Crawler zu tun hat. Wer gerne eine etwas offenere Welt erforscht und nebenbei ausgiebige Schwätzchen mit Dorfbewohnern führt, der könnte von Origin schwer enttäuscht werden. Und auch das Prequel-Format mit jeder Menge Fanservice für Kenner der ersten beiden Teile, ist eine etwas zwiespältige Angelegenheit. Nichtsdestotrotz ist Ys Origin eine runde Sache für Serienfreunde und Action-RPG-Liebhaber. Für den Preis von 15,99 € (Steam-Preis) bekommt man ein schönes Spiel für seine Download-Spiele-Bibliothek. Allerdings sollte man sich für das Geld erst einmal ein paar andere Ys-Spiele gönnen, bevor man sich Origin zulegt.


Pro und Kontra:

Pro:
- schnelles, unkompliziertes Hack'n'Slay-Spielprinzip
- anspruchsvolle und toll inszenierte Bosskämpfe
- hoher Wiederspielwert durch drei spielbare Charaktere und zusätzlichen Spielmodi
- nette Story mit viel Fanservice für Kenner der ersten beiden Teile
- die neuen Hauptcharaktere verfügen über eine eigene Persönlichkeit und können sogar sprechen^^

Neutral:
- Ys Origin ist ein Dungeon-Crawler. Dinge wie die Erforschung einer Spielwelt, Dialoge mit NPCs und dergleichen sind also kaum enthalten
- es ist ein Prequel und keine Fortführung von Adols Abenteuern

Kontra:
- das gesamte Spiel findet in einem optisch recht unspektakulären Turm-Dungeon statt, was auf Dauer recht öde werden kann
- viele Rätsel wurden nahezu 1 zu 1 aus dem ersten Teil übernommen
- der Soundtrack gehört nicht unbedingt zu den Besten der Serie

28112824.review:
¿Que tan bueno es?
En la pasada venta de otoño compre muchos juegos considerados top tier en su epoca y que yo no tuve la oprtunidad de jugar como Fallout New Vegas, Mass Effect o Bioshock... y aun asi este es el que mas supo ganarse mi tiempo.

No les dire que es el juego perfecto pero si un muy buen juego por varias razones:
-Versatil: a pesar de que muchos lo clasifican simplemente como juego de rol tiene muchos elementos de otros generos como hack and slash y platformers bastante bien logrados
-Simple: A pesar de ser un JRPG no tiene una historia super enredada con horas y horas de dialogos y 813165 personajes que recordar sus nombres como muchos otros del genero, el juego es rapido y lleno de accion
-La musica es hermosa: (no creo necesitar explicar esto)
-Visualmente increible: Aunque el juego esta fuera de su epoca y no pide maquinas potentes para correrlo es bastante agradable a la vista tanto en los escenarios, efectos y diseño de personajes.

El unico punto en contra que podria encontrarle seria que a algunas personas podrias parecerle repetitivo el hecho de estar subiendo una torre durante todo el juego y no disfrutar tanto de escenarios exteriores (en lo personal a mi no me molesta)

El juego es bueno y ahora quiero jugar los anteriores (o siguientes ya que esta es una precuela) eso deberia hablar bastante bien de el.

8.7/10

27089116.review:
[i]Ys Origin[/i] is an absolutely rock-solid action RPG with a ton of play depth, multiple playable characters, and difficulty levels that make meaningful changes to the gameplay (rather than just modifying damage dealt and received). Even absolute neophytes will be able to clear the game on Very Easy, but every time you go up a level, you have to learn new attack patterns and new ways of dealing with them. The only drawback to the difficulty levels is on the Nightmare difficulty, which pulls the nasty trick of nerfing the XP and SP given by mobs, and turns the game into a long, dull grind.

The game opens with two playable characters, and there's a third to be unlocked later. There is also an "extra" version of each of the characters with slightly different abilities, an alternate outfit for Yunica, and an unlockable "arena" mode that pits you against waves of mobs, complete with online cheaterboards if you're curious who can tweak Cheat Engine the most effectively. That's quite a lot of content!

Plot-wise, the game is set in the ancient history of Ys, long before the original [i]Ancient Ys Vanished.[/i] This means that [i]Origin[/i] is the only Ys game not to feature Adol Christin as the main character (he can be unlocked as a bonus character in the arena, but not in story mode). Instead of Adol, the main characters are important members of the priesthood of Ys, as they seek to contain the spread of demonic energy that's destroying their world. If you're familiar with Ys (particularly the original two games, available on Steam as [i]Ys I & II Chronicles +[/i]) there will be lots of material here you'll recognize, but the game is perfectly playable without any Ys background at all.

It's hard to go wrong with [i]Ys Origin[/i] if you like action JRPGs. There's a lot of play here, and it's a good introduction to the elder statesman of the genre.

27018037.review:
Short Answer: This game is a high speed and precision dance between you and each and every boss, with a soundtrack to match.

Long Answer: 
This game uses speed and precision in one heck of a balancing match. On one hand, the characters and fights never last more than a couple of moments. 
On the other hand, (on the higher difficulties) if you mess up at any point, it's back to the save point.
On the other hand, (on the lower difficulties) every fight feels like a race to the finish, only barely sqeuaking through errors.

Only on the highest difficulty did I feel the NEED to grind, and... being completely honest here... the highest difficulty is definitely something I'm only doing for the achievements. Normal mode is enough.

Special note to the devs here though. I bought this game because of the demo. Not only did that demo get me to buy this game, but through this game, I've become a fan of pretty much all of your works that I've found. 
I just wanted to say thank you for the demo that got me into a phenomenal series, and a phenominal developer.

26870046.review:
Hi, I've been a fan of Falcom's games since long before they were ever on Steam, lemme tell you why this game owns:

- Super satisfying and fast paced action RPG gameplay that's not too simple or too complex.

- Three different playable characters with their own unique abilities and stories.

- Super awesome soundtrack that accompanies every moment flawlessly.

- Can run on a toaster just fine.

- Art direction helps keep the dated visuals looking fine even to this day.

- Multiple difficulties that match their descriptors, with the higher difficulties being very hard but not unfair.

I guess the story is a little weak if you weren't already a fan of the series, and the whole game is just one big dungeon. But this game is first and foremost concerned with delivering a tight and highly polished experience and it delivers in spades. Please play this game.
